paragraphs: I am a creative full-stack developer who loves challenges, building websites, apps, and user interfaces, solving problems, and coming up with new exciting solutions.

I have always been interested in technology in general and computers in particular, and since the age of seven, I have used a computer almost every day. It was clear early on that computers were my thing and that they would become a major part of my future.

My first encounter with programming was in high school, more than 20 years ago, when we learned Assembler and C++. I didn’t do much with those skills at the time, but during the same period, I started teaching myself HTML and quickly launched my own business, helping small and medium-sized companies with their websites.

I worked with web design, computer service, and general IT consulting for several years, but around the mid-2000s, I became more and more interested in my other passion—music. In 2007, I decided to switch careers and become a DJ.
At first, I organized club events and played records at bars and techno parties, but eventually, I ended up specializing almost exclusively in weddings.
In 2017, my interest in programming reignited when I revisited my old C++ skills, started building various gadgets with Arduinos, and got hooked again.

Around 2019, I started feeling a bit tired of the DJ profession and decided to return to the IT industry, with a focus on programming—something that has always fascinated me—especially web development.

I enrolled in the courses "Programming 1" and "Digital Creation 1" at NTI School to supplement my high school grades and started studying. After learning the basics of C# at NTI, I decided to continue learning web development on my own, diving into tutorials and working on my own projects.

During this time, I continued working as a DJ alongside my studies, but at the end of 2019, the pandemic hit and effectively put an end to that career. I sold my sound and lighting equipment to support myself and started dedicating all my time to programming. Now, a few years later, I feel confident in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and have several exciting projects in my portfolio.
In july 2024 I graduated from the Higher Vocational Education "Frontend for Mobile and Web" at Chas Academy, and is currently working as a free lance full-stack developer.
